title: Nigel Benn left 'devastated' at having to cancel comeback fight against Sakio Baka
text:
Nigel Benn has apologised to his fans after a shoulder injury curtailed his comeback at the age of 55.

The legendary former world champion was due to return to the ring next month – against 40-year-old Sakio Bika – in his first professional fight since 1996.

But Benn was left 'heartbroken' when he had to pull out of the November 23 fight on Monday, ending his hopes of securing 'closure'.

Nigel Benn has been forced to cancel his much-anticipated comeback fight against Sakio Bika

A statement, released on Tuesday on his behalf, revealed the 55-year-old had been given 'several anti-inflammatory injections' which failed to treat a shoulder problem that was 'significantly affecting his punching power and full movement on one side'.

Benn said: 'I hope my fans will respect that I have no say in this decision.

'Please accept my apologies for any inconvenience this may cause to my loyal fans who have bought tickets, The British and Irish Boxing Authority (BIBA) for sanctioning me, undercard fighters, the venue, suppliers and anyone else who is affected by my announcement. God bless you all.'

Benn had initially retired in 1996 with an 83.3% knockout record before announcing his return

The statement insisted that 'father time has NOT caught up with him at all' and that the veteran's 'preparation and sparring had actually progressed better than expected at this stage'.

'He is devastated at this setback,' it continued. 'Years of organisation has gone into this event, and many people (aside from himself) will be affected by his inability to fight.'

Talks are now ongoing between the Resorts World Arena in Birmingham, BIBA and ticket authorities as they try to rescue a show which already has 10 other fights scheduled.

Alongside the likes of Chris Eubank Snr, Michael Watson and Steve Collins, the 'Dark Destroyer' was part of a golden era of boxing on these shores during the late 1980s and 1990s.

Fans who had bought tickets to see his return can secure a refund.
description: The legendary former world champion was due to return to the ring next month - against 40-year-old Sakio Bika - in his first professional fight since 1996 but has cancelled due to a shoulder injury.
